title: (x) Kings, Gone With the Wind - Mesquite, URW Woodtype D et al {Mike Y, Josep Patau}
content:
[http://www.archimediadesign.com/fonts/fonts.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017144413/http:/www.archimediadesign.com/fonts/fonts.gif)   
   
"Can anybody tell me what any of these fonts are...?   
Or if not any of these exact fonts (shown here in order of preference),   
then anything along similar lines...?"   
   
brett archibald is looking for a font.   
I thought i'd help him out by conecting him with you pros.   
   
-phillip cavette
author: eightone

comments.content:
i shoulda done my research.   
thanks!

FWIW, the typeface that matches your "TOMBSTONE" sample was not shown in the Tuscan samples at MyFonts. That one is Adobe's ["Mesquite"](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017144413/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/mesquite/) (which is part of the Adobe Wood Type collection mentioned in one of the threads Yves linked).

Think the frist font in your order is wood-type from URW   
   
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/wood-type/urw-wood-type-d/testdrive.html?s=Kings&p=72](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017144413/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/wood-type/urw-wood-type-d/testdrive.html?s=Kings&p=72)

And here's some related threads on Typophile:   
 [1](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017144413/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/1116.html) | [2](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017144413/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/8446.html) | [3](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017144413/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/6817.html) | [4](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017144413/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/11506.html) | [5](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017144413/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/11035.html)
